Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

A product is only considered 'Generic' when it is listed under the 'Generic' brand specifically. The brand name 'Generic' at Amazon refers to unbranded products that do not belong to any identifiable brand. An unbranded product does not have a distinctive name or logo.

t: How to Check Amazon Products for Generic brand? | Help Center | Seller Assistant
s: You would see a "GB" icon next to "like" and "dislike" icons. If you hover over it you will see crucial data why this listing could cause problems with Amazon. Moreover you are able to see if the product belong to "Generic" or "Unknown" brand in our Quick View feature.
